question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

RECEIVED

In this set of questions, we are evaluating the probability of two main events: (1) whether Elon Musk will show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, and (2) whether the Apollo 10 Lunar Module will be recovered by 2050. Each of these events has a binary outcome (YES or NO), and they are interrelated through various logical combinations. 

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up)**: This event is likely to be influenced by Musk's public persona and interest in Bitcoin, as well as the significance of the event itself. Given his history of attending high-profile tech and cryptocurrency events, I estimate a moderate to high probability of him showing up, let's say around 0.65.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up)**: This is simply the complement of P, so it should be approximately 1 - P = 0.35.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Musk attending)**: This question is similar to P, so it will have a similar probability estimate, likely around 0.65 as well.

4. **Q (Apollo 10 Lunar Module recovery)**: This event is more uncertain due to the unknown location of the Lunar Module and the challenges involved in recovering it. I would estimate a lower probability here, around 0.25, reflecting the complexity of the task.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occur)**: The probability of both events happening will be lower than either event happening individually, as they are not guaranteed to happen together. I would estimate this around 0.15.

6. **P_or_Q (Either event occurs)**: This probability should be higher than either event happening alone, reflecting the likelihood of at least one of the two events occurring. I would estimate this around 0.75.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Apollo 10 recovered, Musk does not show)**: This event is more complex as it combines the uncertainty of both events. I would estimate this around 0.10.

8. **Q_given_P (If Musk shows up, will Apollo 10 be recovered)**: This conditional probability would likely be higher than Q alone, as Musk's presence at the event could potentially raise interest or funding for the recovery efforts. I would estimate this around 0.30.

In summary, I expect a moderate probability for Musk attending the conference and a lower probability for the recovery of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module. The relationships between these events will be reflected in the consistency checks.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other outcomes will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

In this scenario, we are analyzing two primary events: whether Elon Musk will show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (P) and whether the Apollo 10 Lunar Module will be recovered by 2050 (Q). 

1. **Event P (Elon Musk's Attendance)**: Given Musk's high-profile nature and past involvement in cryptocurrency events, I estimate a moderate probability of him attending the Bitcoin Nashville 2024. This estimate considers factors like his public persona, the significance of the event, and historical precedents of his attendance at similar events.

2. **Event not_P (Elon Musk's Absence)**: This is simply the complement of P. If I estimate P at 0.65, then not_P would be 0.35. 

3. **Event para_P (Possibility of Attendance)**: Since para_P is essentially asking the same question as P but framed differently, I would assign it the same probability as P, which is 0.65.

4. **Event Q (Recovery of Apollo 10 Lunar Module)**: This event is more uncertain due to the challenges involved in recovering a lost space module. Given the historical context and the current unknowns about its location, I might estimate a lower probability, say 0.25.

5. **Event P_and_Q (Both Events Occur)**: This event's probability is dependent on both P and Q occurring. Given their potential independence, I would calculate this as the product of their probabilities, which would be 0.65 * 0.25 = 0.1625.

6. **Event P_or_Q (At least one Occurs)**: This event captures the likelihood of either event occurring. Given the probabilities, I would calculate this using the formula P + Q - P_and_Q.

7. **Event Q_and_not_P (Apollo 10 Recovered but Musk Not Attending)**: This event is the probability of Q occurring while P does not. This can be calculated as Q * not_P, assuming independence.

8. **Event Q_given_P (Recovery Given Musk's Attendance)**: This conditional probability would be assessed based on the likelihood of Q occurring if P is true. Given the nature of the events, I might estimate this as a moderate value, reflecting that Musk's presence might have a slight positive influence on the recovery efforts.

In summary, the relationships between these events are crucial for calculating the probabilities accurately. The independence of events P and Q allows for straightforward calculations for combined events, while the conditional probabilities introduce additional complexity that must be carefully considered.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

question.title: Will both Mike Pence and Ted Cruz be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Mike Pence and Ted Cruz are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either or both are not selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

In this scenario, we are evaluating the probability of two different events: Elon Musk showing up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 conference (P) and the recovery of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module by 2050 (Q). 

1. **P (Elon Musk showing up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: Given Elon Musk's high-profile nature and previous engagements at cryptocurrency events, I estimate a moderate probability of him showing up. This is influenced by the significance of the event and his known interest in Bitcoin.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not showing up)**: This is simply the complement of P, and is calculated as 1 - P.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Elon Musk attending)**: This is likely to be aligned with P, as it asks about the same event from a different perspective. 

4. **Q (Recovery of Apollo 10 Lunar Module)**: The recovery of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is uncertain due to its current unknown location and the challenges involved in space recovery missions. Thus, I estimate a lower probability for this event.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occurring)**: The probability of both events happening is likely to be low, as the recovery of the Lunar Module does not directly influence Musk's attendance at the conference, but both events are independent.

6. **P_or_Q (Either event occurring)**: This probability is influenced by the individual probabilities of P and Q. Since both probabilities are not extremely low, the likelihood of at least one occurring is higher.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Recovery of the Lunar Module and Musk not showing up)**: This is a combination of two independent events, and the probability is expected to be low since both events are not highly probable on their own.

8. **Q_given_P (Recovery of the Lunar Module given Musk shows up)**: This conditional probability is tricky because Musk's attendance does not affect the recovery of the Lunar Module, but it can be estimated based on the likelihood of Q.

**Independence**: The events P and Q are independent of each other since the occurrence of one does not affect the occurrence of the other. This independence is crucial for calculating joint probabilities (like P_and_Q and P_or_Q). 

**Consistency Rules**: I will ensure that all probability estimates adhere to the consistency rules provided, such as ensuring that the probabilities of complementary events (P and not_P) sum to 1, and that the calculations for joint and conditional probabilities follow the specified mathematical relationships.

question.title: Will either Mike Pence or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Mike Pence or Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In this set of questions, we are evaluating two separate events: whether Elon Musk will show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and whether the Apollo 10 Lunar Module will be recovered by 2050. These events are independent of each other, meaning the outcome of one does not influence the outcome of the other. 

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up)**: Given Elon Musk's prominence and previous involvement in the cryptocurrency community, I estimate a moderate probability that he will attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024. This estimate is influenced by historical attendance at similar events and his public interest in Bitcoin.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up)**: This is simply the complement of P, calculated as 1 - P. Since we are estimating P at a certain value, not_P will follow accordingly.

3. **para_P (Possibility of attendance)**: This is expected to be similar to P since it essentially asks the same question in a different phrasing. 

4. **Q (Apollo 10 Lunar Module recovery)**: This event is more uncertain due to the unknown location of the module and the challenges involved in space recovery. I estimate a lower probability for this event based on the historical context and current efforts.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occur)**: This probability is determined by the intersection of P and Q. Since P and Q are independent, P_and_Q can be calculated as P * Q.

6. **P_or_Q (At least one event occurs)**: This is calculated using the formula for the union of two independent events, which is P + Q - P_and_Q.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Apollo 10 recovered but Musk does not show)**: This event requires both conditions to be true, which can be calculated in a similar manner to P_and_Q, considering the independence of events.

8. **Q_given_P (Apollo 10 recovery given Musk shows)**: This is a conditional probability that requires careful consideration. If Elon Musk shows up, it might not directly affect the recovery of the Lunar Module, but it can be influenced by the public interest generated by his presence at the conference.

Overall, I am ensuring that all calculated probabilities adhere to the consistency rules outlined. Each probability is interrelated, and I will check for consistency to ensure that the estimates hold up mathematically.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

In assessing the probability estimates for the given events, I will consider the relationships between the questions and how they affect each other. 

1. **P (Elon Musk showing up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: I would estimate a moderate probability based on Musk's past involvement in cryptocurrency and events. Given the importance of the event, I might assign a probability of around 0.60.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not showing up at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is simply the complement of P. If P is 0.60, then not_P would be 0.40.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Elon Musk attending)**: This is closely related to P, so I would assign a similar probability, perhaps 0.60 as well.

4. **Q (Apollo 10's Lunar Module recovery by 2050)**: The recovery of a historical artifact like the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is uncertain. Given the challenges of space recovery, I might assign a lower probability, perhaps around 0.25.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occurring)**: This probability would be the product of P and Q if we assume independence. Therefore, I would estimate it as P * Q = 0.60 * 0.25 = 0.15.

6. **P_or_Q (Either event occurring)**: This would be calculated using the formula P + Q - P_and_Q. If P is 0.60 and Q is 0.25, then P_or_Q = 0.60 + 0.25 - 0.15 = 0.70.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Apollo 10 recovered and Musk not showing up)**: This probability could be calculated as Q * not_P, which would be 0.25 * 0.40 = 0.10.

8. **Q_given_P (Given Musk shows up, will Apollo 10 be recovered)**: This probability might be influenced by the first event, so I would estimate it to be higher than Q alone, perhaps around 0.30.

In summary, the relationships between the questions indicate that while P and Q are independent events, their combinations (like P_and_Q and Q_and_not_P) will need careful consideration based on their estimated probabilities. I will ensure that my estimates obey the consistency rules provided.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

8. **Q_given_P (Given Musk shows up, will the Lunar Module be recovered?)**: This conditional probability may be influenced by P, but I will initially treat it as independent for the estimate.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, or Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body: (a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination for a Yes resolution. (b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

In this case, we are looking at two main events: whether Elon Musk will show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (P) and whether the Apollo 10 Lunar Module will be recovered by 2050 (Q). 

1. **P (Elon Musk at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This event is quite specific and depends on various factors such as Musk's schedule, interest in Bitcoin, and the significance of the event. Given Musk's previous engagements and influence in the cryptocurrency space, I estimate a moderate probability of him attending. 

2. **not_P**: This is simply the complement of P. If I believe there's a 70% chance he will attend, then there is a 30% chance he will not.

3. **para_P**: This question is essentially the same as P, so I expect it to have the same probability as P. 

4. **Q (Apollo 10 Lunar Module Recovery)**: The recovery of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is a much more uncertain event due to its unknown location and the challenges of space recovery missions. I would estimate a lower probability for this event, perhaps around 20-30%. 

5. **P_and_Q**: This event requires both P and Q to happen. Given that both events are somewhat independent but also can influence each other (e.g., if Musk were to promote the recovery of the Lunar Module), I would estimate this probability to be lower than either P or Q alone, reflecting the combined uncertainty.

6. **P_or_Q**: This event will resolve positively if either P or Q occurs. Since I believe both events have a reasonable chance of happening, I expect this probability to be higher than either P or Q alone.

7. **Q_and_not_P**: This event requires Q to happen while P does not. Given the independent nature of these events, I expect this probability to be low but not negligible.

8. **Q_given_P**: This conditional probability reflects the chance of Q occurring given that P occurs. Given that Musk's involvement in Bitcoin could potentially increase interest in space exploration, I might estimate this probability to be slightly higher than Q alone.

Overall, I will ensure that all these estimates are consistent with the rules provided, particularly focusing on their relationships and the mathematical constraints between them.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

In evaluating the probability estimates for the given questions, I consider the relationships between the events and the potential impacts of each event on the others.

1. **P (Elon Musk showing up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is a binary event that depends on various factors, including Musk's schedule and interest in the event. Given his previous involvement in cryptocurrency, I estimate a moderate probability of 0.65.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not showing up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is the complement of P, and thus I estimate it to be 0.35, reflecting that it is likely he may not attend but is still plausible.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Elon Musk attending the Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is similar to P, and I estimate it to be equal to P at 0.65, as the phrasing indicates a direct correlation.

4. **Q (Recovery of Apollo 10's Lunar Module by 2050)**: This event is more uncertain due to its historical context and technological challenges. I estimate a lower probability of 0.40 for this event.

5. **P_and_Q (Both P and Q happening)**: The probability of both events occurring is likely lower than either event alone, so I estimate it at 0.26, reflecting the joint occurrence of these independent events.

6. **P_or_Q (Either P or Q happening)**: This would be a higher probability than either event alone. I calculate it using the formula for the union of two events, estimating it to be 0.70.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Q occurring while not P)**: This scenario also involves independent events, and I estimate this at 0.15, as it reflects the occurrence of Q while Musk does not attend.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurring given P)**: This conditional probability is likely higher than Q alone but still less than certainty. I estimate it at 0.50, reflecting the increased likelihood of recovery if Musk attends.

Overall, I ensure that all estimates respect the consistency rules, particularly those regarding complements, intersections, and unions of probabilities. I expect that the relationships between these events will hold true and adjust the probabilities accordingly to maintain consistency.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not showing up)**: This is the complementary event to P. If P is estimated at around 0.65, then not_P would be 0.35, reflecting the uncertainty surrounding Musk's attendance.

8. **Q_given_P (Recovery given Musk shows up)**: This conditional probability is interesting as it suggests that if Musk shows up, it might increase the likelihood of the recovery due to potential media attention or funding. I would estimate this to be around 0.25.

**Independence and Relationships**: The events are somewhat independent; however, the conditional relationship of Q given P suggests that there could be a correlation between Musk's attendance and the recovery efforts. The probabilities must adhere to the consistency rules provided, ensuring that the relationships between these events are logically sound.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if either condition is not met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

In this scenario, we have several binary forecasting questions related to two main events: Elon Musk's appearance at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 conference and the recovery of Apollo 10's Lunar Module by 2050. 

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up)**: This probability is influenced by various factors, including Elon Musk's past involvement in Bitcoin and cryptocurrency events, his public persona, and any announcements or hints suggesting his attendance. Given the significance of the event, I might estimate this probability moderately high, but not certain, as there are many variables at play.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up)**: This is simply the complement of P, hence it should reflect a lower probability than P. If P is estimated at, say, 0.60, then not_P would be 0.40.

3. **para_P (Possibility of attendance)**: This is closely related to P, as it essentially asks about the likelihood of him attending without the binary resolution of the question. Therefore, I would expect this to be similar to P.

4. **Q (Apollo 10's Lunar Module recovery)**: This event is more uncertain due to the unknown location of the module and the challenges involved in recovering it. The probability might be lower compared to P, given the historical context and technical challenges.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occur)**: This probability would be lower than either P or Q alone, as it requires both conditions to be true simultaneously. The estimate would reflect the joint probability of both events occurring.

6. **P_or_Q (Either event occurs)**: This would be higher than both individual probabilities since it allows for either event to happen, not necessarily both.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Apollo 10 recovered and Musk does not show up)**: This is a combination of Q being true while P is false. The estimate would depend on how likely I think Q is in conjunction with the likelihood of not P.

8. **Q_given_P (Recovery given Musk shows up)**: This conditional probability reflects how the likelihood of the recovery of the Lunar Module might change if Musk is indeed present at the conference. This could be influenced by factors such as public interest or funding for recovery efforts that might be associated with his attendance.

In terms of independence, P and Q are largely independent events, as one does not directly influence the other. However, the conditional probabilities (like Q_given_P) indicate a potential relationship where Musk's presence may affect public interest or funding for the recovery project.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

For the questions provided, I will evaluate the probabilities based on the context of each question and their logical relationships. 

1. **P (Elon Musk at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This event is likely dependent on various factors such as Musk's schedule, interest in Bitcoin, and the event's significance. Given Musk's history with Bitcoin and his public persona, I would estimate a moderate probability of him showing up.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not at Bitcoin Nashville 2024)**: This is the complement of P. The probability of him not attending should equal 1 minus the probability of him attending. 

3. **para_P (Possibility of Musk attending)**: This is essentially the same as P, so they should have the same probability.

4. **Q (Apollo 10 Lunar Module recovery by 2050)**: The recovery of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is uncertain due to the challenges of locating and retrieving it. The probability would be lower given the unknowns involved in such a recovery effort.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occurring)**: This probability should be lower than both P and Q, as it is conditional on both events happening simultaneously.

6. **P_or_Q (Either event occurring)**: This probability should be higher than either P or Q alone, as it encompasses both possibilities.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Apollo 10 recovery and Musk not attending)**: This combines the probability of Q with the complement of P, which should be a lower estimate than either event happening alone.

8. **Q_given_P (Recovery given Musk's attendance)**: This conditional probability would depend on the relationship between the two events. If Musk's attendance somehow increases the likelihood of the recovery, the probability might be adjusted accordingly. 

In terms of consistency, I will need to ensure that the probabilities adhere to the mathematical relationships defined in the consistency rules. Specifically, the relationships between P and not_P, the conjunctions and disjunctions involving P and Q, and the conditional probabilities must all align correctly.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

8. **Q_given_P (Q occurs given P occurs)**: This conditional probability will depend on how the occurrence of P influences Q. If P's occurrence positively influences Q, this probability should be higher.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

The Lunar Module flown on Apollo 10 is the only flown lunar module which didn't end up crashing into the Moon or burning up in Earth's atmosphere.
After 'dress rehearsal' testing in lunar orbit, during which the Lunar Module came within 8.4 nautical miles of the lunar surface, the ascent engine performed a burn to depletion which sent the craft into interplanetary space and the vehicle is currently in a heliocentric orbit. The location of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module is unknown as of May 2019, but efforts are underway to find it.
As a unique historical artefact from the original golden age of human spaceflight, this Lunar Module would certainly make for an interesting museum exhibit.
This question asks: by 1 January 2050, will the lost ascent stage of the Apollo 10 Lunar Module be recovered (i.e. located, captured, and physically transported to some location where humans have a presence at that time, such as Earth, the Moon, Mars or elsewhere) successfully?

Overall, I expect these events to have varying degrees of independence, particularly P and Q, as they pertain to different domains (cryptocurrency vs. space exploration). However, the conditional relationships (like Q_given_P) suggest some interdependence that should be reflected in the estimates.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, and not through speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the date. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated such that on July 15th he is not removed or blocked, the question resolves negatively.

(b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as "No". The question solely determines by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

In this set of questions, we have two main events: (1) Elon Musk showing up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 (P) and (2) the recovery of Apollo 10's Lunar Module by 2050 (Q). These two events are independent of each other, meaning the occurrence of one does not influence the occurrence of the other. However, they are linked in the context of the combined events (P_and_Q, P_or_Q, Q_and_not_P). 

For estimating the probabilities:

1. **P (Elon Musk showing up)**: Considering his prominence in the Bitcoin community, I estimate a high probability that he will attend the conference, say around 0.70.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk not showing up)**: This is simply the complement of P, so it would be 1 - P, which gives us 0.30.

3. **para_P (Possibility of Elon Musk attending)**: This is similar to P, so I would assign it the same probability, 0.70.

4. **Q (Apollo 10 Lunar Module recovery)**: Given the complexities and uncertainties involved in space recovery missions, I would assign a lower probability, such as 0.25.

5. **P_and_Q (Both events occurring)**: Since P and Q are independent, the probability of both occurring is P * Q, which would be 0.70 * 0.25 = 0.175.

6. **P_or_Q (Either event occurring)**: The probability of either event occurring can be calculated using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q, which gives us 0.70 + 0.25 - 0.175 = 0.875.

7. **Q_and_not_P (Apollo 10 recovery and Musk not showing up)**: This can be calculated as Q * not_P, yielding 0.25 * 0.30 = 0.075.

8. **Q_given_P (Apollo 10 recovery given Musk shows up)**: This is a conditional probability where we assume P has occurred. Since P does not affect Q, I would consider it the same as Q, so it remains 0.25.

After calculating these probabilities, I will check each one against the consistency rules to ensure they align correctly.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

In evaluating the probability estimates for the questions related to Elon Musk's attendance at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and the recovery of Apollo 10's Lunar Module, I considered the following:

1. **P (Elon Musk shows up)**: This event is contingent on various factors such as his schedule, interest in Bitcoin, and the significance of the event. Given Musk's history with Bitcoin and his public persona, I estimate a moderate probability of 0.65.

2. **not_P (Elon Musk does not show up)**: This is simply the complement of P, so it will be 1 - P, which gives us 0.35.

3. **para_P (Possibility of attendance)**: This is essentially the same as P, as it asks if he will attend. Thus, I will assign it the same probability of 0.65.

4. **Q (Recovery of Apollo 10's Lunar Module)**: Given the historical significance of the Lunar Module and ongoing interest in space exploration, I estimate a lower probability of recovery by 2050 at 0.40.
